	Self-driven, persuasive, and able to operate independently.

Project Pursuit Manager Job at Hobark International Limited




        
    

        
        Hobark International Limited (HIL) is the parent company of the Hobark group operating in the oil and gas industry. The company was incorporated in 1998, starting as a staffing agency based in Port Harcourt. Currently we have offices in 4 countries with our head office in Lagos.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Project Pursuit Manager

Job Location: Port Harcourt, Rivers / Lagos
Job Type: Permanent/Full time

Job Description
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Continuously monitor, map, and track major oil, gas, and energy projects from early conceptual and FEED stages through EPC award and execution.
	Map and maintain customer and EPC organization structures (organograms) for each targeted project to identify influencers and decision paths.
	Provide regular updates to management on project status, competition landscape, and potential opportunities.
	Handover secured projects seamlessly to the execution team with full background documentation.


Key Responsibilities


	Bachelor’s Degree in electrical / Instrumentation / Electronics Engineering or related discipline
	10 - 15 years of experience in Oil & Gas projects, including at least 5 years in a business development / project pursuit / client-facing role.
	Proven track record of engaging with IOCs, EPCs, and regulatory agencies in Nigeria or West Africa.
	Strong understanding of E&I systems (LV/MV electrical, automation, control, and instrumentation).
	Demonstrated ability to develop relationships, influence decisions, and close deals on large capital projects.
	Excellent networking and stakeholder management skills.
	Strong technical understanding of E&I systems and project execution cycles.
	Commercial awareness and strategic pursuit planning capability.
	Self-driven, persuasive, and able to operate independently.
	Effective communication, presentation, and reporting skills.

Receptionist Job at Esporta Suites Hotel and Resorts Limited




        
    

        
        Esporta Hotels Limited was incorporated under the laws of Nigeria in 2004. It is an investment company holding varying interests in the different companies within the group. We specialize in airline representation and management, business and leisure travel management, training, and travel technology solutions. GHI Assets has business interests in Angola, Benin Republic, Cameroon, South Africa, the United States of America, and Nigeria with plans to expand into more African countries. We strive to be market leaders in our businesses employing cutting-edge technology to achieve sustainable profitable growth.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Receptionist
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Job Location: Ondo Town, Ondo
Employment Type: Full-time

Key Responsibilities


	Greet and welcome guests warmly upon arrival.
	Handle guest check-ins and check-outs efficiently.
	Answer phone calls, respond to inquiries, and make reservations.
	Provide accurate information about the hotel, rooms, and services.
	Coordinate with housekeeping and other departments to ensure smooth guest service.
	Maintain a clean and professional front desk area at all times.
	Handle guest complaints or escalate them appropriately.


Requirements


	Minimum of OND or equivalent qualification.
	Previous hotel or hospitality experience is an advantage.
	Good communication and interpersonal skills.
	Neat appearance and excellent customer service attitude.
	Basic computer skills and familiarity with hotel booking systems (an added advantage).
	Ability to work flexible shifts, including weekends and public holidays.


Salary
N80,000 - N100,000 monthly.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Cover letter to: jobs@esportahotels.com using “Hotel Receptionist Application” as the subject of the email.

  "description": "Trade Lenda is a digital bank for Small and Medium Scale Enterprises (SMEs), empowering them through strategic financing to sustain business growth and contribute towards economic prosperity.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Mobile App Developer

Job Location:&nbsp;Maryland, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time&nbsp;(Hybrid/Remote)

Key Responsibilities


	Design, Develop, and Maintain Mobile Applications: Create high-quality, scalable, and efficient mobile applications for iOS and Android platforms.
	Collaboration with UI/UX Designers: Work closely with designers to ensure a smooth user experience and seamless integration of app features.
	Cross-Platform Development: Utilize suitable programming languages and frameworks like Flutter, React Native, or Kotlin Multiplatform to develop cross-platform mobile applications.
	API Integration: Develop and integrate APIs to ensure seamless communication between the mobile app and backend services, and work with third-party libraries to enhance app functionality.
	Testing and Debugging: Conduct thorough testing and debugging to identify and resolve issues, ensuring optimal app performance and security compliance.
	Deployment and Maintenance: Deploy and maintain mobile applications on App Store and Google Play.
	Troubleshooting: Resolve issues reported by users and QA teams.
	Code Quality: Ensure clean, efficient, and well-documented code, following best practices.
	Staying Up-to-Date: Keep abreast of the latest mobile app development trends, technologies, and best practices.


Qualifications


	Interested candidates should possess a Bachelor&#39;s Degree with 2-3 years experience.


Technical Requirements:


	Proficiency in programming languages like Java, Swift, Kotlin, or Dart.
	Experience with cross-platform development frameworks.
	Knowledge of APIs, third-party libraries, and mobile app development best practices.
	Familiarity with backend technologies like Node.js, Django, Firebase, or Golang.
	Experience with code versioning tools like Git.


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should forward their Resume to:&nbsp;careers@tradelenda.com&nbsp;using &quot;Mobile App Developer&quot; as the subject of the email.",

Mobile App Developer Job at Trade Lenda




        
    

        
        Trade Lenda is a digital bank for Small and Medium Scale Enterprises (SMEs), empowering them through strategic financing to sustain business growth and contribute towards economic prosperity.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Mobile App Developer

Job Location: Maryland, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time (Hybrid/Remote)

Key Responsibilities
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Design, Develop, and Maintain Mobile Applications: Create high-quality, scalable, and efficient mobile applications for iOS and Android platforms.
	Collaboration with UI/UX Designers: Work closely with designers to ensure a smooth user experience and seamless integration of app features.
	Cross-Platform Development: Utilize suitable programming languages and frameworks like Flutter, React Native, or Kotlin Multiplatform to develop cross-platform mobile applications.
	API Integration: Develop and integrate APIs to ensure seamless communication between the mobile app and backend services, and work with third-party libraries to enhance app functionality.
	Testing and Debugging: Conduct thorough testing and debugging to identify and resolve issues, ensuring optimal app performance and security compliance.
	Deployment and Maintenance: Deploy and maintain mobile applications on App Store and Google Play.
	Troubleshooting: Resolve issues reported by users and QA teams.
	Code Quality: Ensure clean, efficient, and well-documented code, following best practices.
	Staying Up-to-Date: Keep abreast of the latest mobile app development trends, technologies, and best practices.


Qualifications


	Interested candidates should possess a Bachelor's Degree with 2-3 years experience.


Technical Requirements:


	Proficiency in programming languages like Java, Swift, Kotlin, or Dart.
	Experience with cross-platform development frameworks.
	Knowledge of APIs, third-party libraries, and mobile app development best practices.
	Familiarity with backend technologies like Node.js, Django, Firebase, or Golang.
	Experience with code versioning tools like Git.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should forward their Resume to: careers@tradelenda.com using "Mobile App Developer" as the subject of the email.
